merger_name: Symal Group - Timms Group and L&D Group

targets.name: Churinga (Investments) Pty Ltd as trustee for THE CHURINGA Trust

other_parties.name: Timms Investments (Qld) Pty Ltd as trustee for the Timms Investments Trust
Jones Investments (Qld) Pty Ltd as trustee for the Jones Investments Trust
K Parsons Investments (Qld) Pty Ltd as trustee for the Parsons Investment Trust
Clarkson-Jones Investments (Qld) Pty Ltd as trustee for the Clarkson-Jones Investments Trust

anzsic_codes.name: Other Heavy and Civil Engineering Construction

merger_description:
Symal Group Limited (Symal Group), through its wholly owned subsidiaries, proposes to acquire all of the business and assets of:

* the Timms business from Timms Contracting Pty Ltd, Timms Hire Pty Ltd and Teagun Investments Pty Ltd (collectively referred to as Timms Group); and
* the L&D business from Churinga (Investments) Pty Ltd as trustee for the Churinga Trust and Adawin Pty Ltd (collectively referred to as L&D Group).

As part of the transaction, Symal NG Property Pty Ltd may enter into a licence for the property located at 36 Frederick Street, Northgate, QLD 4013 (the Property), which is owned by Clarkson-Jones Investments (Qld) Pty Ltd, K Parsons Investments (Qld) Pty Ltd, Timms Investments (Qld) Pty Ltd and Jones Investments (Qld) Pty Ltd.

Symal Group is an Australian based self-performing contractor providing construction and engineering services, specialising in the roads, rail, defence, justice, ports and energy sectors. The services provided by Symal Group include various forms of construction, project management, plant and equipment hire, material sales and recycling and repurposing.

Timms Group is a Tier 2 contractor that provides plant-intensive civil works and hauling services for infrastructure and construction projects in Queensland. L&D Group is a Tier 1 contractor on infrastructure and construction projects in Queensland, including the provision of demolition, bulk earthworks, site preparation and construction services.

Symal Group does not currently supply the services offered by Timms Group and L&D Group in Queensland.

events.title: Symal Group / Timms Group and L&D Group -Phase 1 Determination
events.determination_commission_division: Determination made by a division of the Commission constituted by a direction issued pursuant to section 19 of the Act

determination_table_content.details:
Symal Group Limited through the following wholly owned
subsidiaries:
• Symal Management Pty Ltd
• Symal Contractors (QLD) Pty Ltd
• Syl TM Contracting Pty Ltd
• T Haulage Pty Ltd
• T Operations Pty Ltd
• Symal NG Property Pty Ltd
(collectively referred to as Symal Group),
proposes to acquire all of the business and assets of the:
• Timms business from Timms Contracting Pty Ltd, Timms
Hire Pty Ltd and Teagun Investments Pty Ltd (collectively
referred to as Timms Group) and
• L&D business from Churinga (Investments) Pty Ltd as
trustee for the Churinga Trust and Adawin Pty Ltd
(collectively referred to as L&D Group).
As part of the transaction, Symal NG Property Pty Ltd may enter into
a licence for the property located at 36 Frederick Street, Northgate,
QLD 4013 (the Property) which is owned by Clarkson-Jones
Investments (Qld) Pty Ltd, K Parsons Investments (Qld) Pty Ltd,
Timms Investments (Qld) Pty Ltd and Jones Investments (Qld) Pty
Ltd.
Symal Group, Timms Group, and L&D Group are together referred to
as the Parties.

The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission has
determined under section 51ABZE(1) of the Competition and
Consumer Act 2010 (Cth) that the Acquisition may be put into effect.

Symal Group Limited is an Australian based self-performing
contractor providing construction and engineering services,
specialising in the roads, rail, defence, justice, ports and energy
sectors. The services provided by Symal Group Limited and its
subsidiaries include various forms of construction, project
management, plant and equipment hire, material sales and recycling
and repurposing.
The Timms Group is a contractor that provides plant-intensive civil
works and hauling services for infrastructure and construction
projects in Queensland.
The L&D Group is a contractor on infrastructure and construction
projects in Queensland, including the provision of demolition, bulk
earthworks, site preparation and construction services.

There is no direct overlap between the Parties. While the Parties
each supply civil contracting and construction services, Timms
Group and L&D Group supply civil contracting and construction
services in Queensland only, where Symal Group does not have a
direct presence in relation to the supply of these services.

When making a determination in Phase 1, the Australian Competition
and Consumer Commission (ACCC) undertakes a competition
assessment and considers whether it is appropriate for an
acquisition to be approved or subject to further assessment in
Phase 2 in accordance with section 51ABZJ of the Competition and
Consumer Act 2010 (Cth) (the Act). In doing so, the ACCC must have
regard to the object of the Act and all relevant matters, including the
interests of consumers.
For more information about the ACCC’s approach to considering
notified acquisitions, see the ACCC’s merger assessment guidelines
and interim merger process guidelines.
In conducting its competition assessment, the ACCC has considered
the information and documents that were submitted with the
notification form as well as further information provided by the
Parties following pre-notification engagement with the ACCC.
The ACCC has determined that the Acquisition may be put into
effect as it considers that the Acquisition is unlikely to have the
effect of substantially lessening competition in any market. In
reaching its decision, and based on the material before it, the ACCC
makes the following findings:
• The Parties would continue to face competition from
alternative suppliers of civil contracting and construction
haulage services in Queensland, including several
competitors which are of a similar or larger size to the
Parties.
• The Parties are not close competitors, as the Timms Group
and L&D Group focus on supplying civil contracting and
construction services within Brisbane, Queensland. Symal
Group does not have any direct presence in relation to these
services in Queensland.

A notifying party, or other person who has been allowed to do so by
the Australian Competition Tribunal, may apply for review if they are
dissatisfied with the determination. Pursuant to section 100C of the
Act, applications for review of the determination are to be made to
the Australian Competition Tribunal before the end of 14 calendar
days after this statement of reasons was included on the ACCC’s
Acquisitions Register. To confirm whether there has been any
application for review, please contact the Australian Competition
Tribunal.
